items.description: It's a Cerulium bar.
Cerulium ore. Can be used for smelting or repairs. Select ore and right click pickaxe.
It's a Ferozium bar.
It's a Rubium bar.
Rubium ore. Can be used for smelting or repairs. Select ore and right click pickaxe.
It's a Violium bar.
An accordion. Get those arms working!
An acoustic guitar. Perfect for campfire songs.
It's an aegisalt bar.
It's aegisalt. Can be used for smelting or repairs. Select ore and right click pickaxe.
A burger made of green alien meat. Mm!
A raw slab of weird, stringy alien meat.
A mysterious alien skull that you can wear. Macabre.
A healthy mix of banana slices and grapes.
Press F. Use this tech, spawn a mech. Then destroy things.
Standard issue Apex Commander jacket.
Standard issue Apex Commander pants.
Standard issue Apex Navy jacket.
Standard issue Apex Navy pants.
Standard issue Apex Officer jacket.
Standard issue Apex Officer pants.
A little bit of metal.
Nicely carved wooden platforms.
A colourful support block.
A colourful wall panel.
Standard issue Apex Specialist jacket.
Standard issue Apex Specialist pants.
A broken sword. Looks like it used to be special.
Big Axe. A Big Axe for a Big Ape.
Gorillatooth. A hefty, chunky broadsword.
An Impervium laced jacket that offers far more protection than the average observer might suspect.
Ape's Ruin. A small, chunky dagger that can pierce the toughest hide.
Baboom. A barrel-breaking mallet.
This hood suits the dark demeanour of those who have overthrown regimes singlehandedly.
They may be sleek, but these pants and boots are laced with hardened Impervium.
Chimp's Grin. A hefty, chunky shortsword.
King Wrong. A strange Apex spear with an unusual design.
Apax. An axe for an Apex.
Apesticker. A quality sword.
A cheap military-grade Chestguard which protects the most vital organs.
Simisickle. A curved dagger.
Thunderpunch. A basic warhammer.
A mass-produced iron mask that somewhat disguises the wearer's identity.
These pants and boots allow for flexibility whilst still providing protection from the elements!
Lil Apesticker. A quality sword.
The Prodder. A small blade on a stick.
Bananaxe. The blade is shaped like a banana.
The Backscratcher. A relatively decent fencing sword.
Upper body armour that has segmented steel plates across it.
Barkpeeler. A short, straight dagger.
Monkey's Molar. A hammer shaped like a huge tooth.
This hood and mask gives the wearer a rebellious appearance.
Steel-plated leg armour that doesn't restrict the movement of the wearer.
The Neckscratcher. A relatively decent fencing sword.
Fruitpicker. A spiky spear.
The Peeler. Its blades look like banana peel.
Big Apehander. A standard blade.
A jacket that has titanium shoulder guards and shock-resistant padding.
Bananablade. A dagger the exact size of a banana.
The Riveter. A precise hammer.
This striped headwear leaves only the the eyes visible.
Shock-resistant pants with titanium plated boots.
Apehander. A standard blade.
Fruitpicker Prime. A very spiky spear.
Apestooth. A hooked axe.
Haircutter. A regular broadsword.
The Durasteel inner lining of this jacket make it both fashionable and tough.
Banana Splitter. A dagger perfect for cutting bananas.
Gorillakilla. A hefty warhammer.
This bandana and blindfold are perfect for the budding Revolutionary.
Durasteel-lined trousers, accompanied by heavy duty boots.
Beardtrimmer. A regular shortsword.
Tailcutter. A barbed spear.
The Coif. An axe styled after a popular haircut.
Barbaryan Sword. A sturdy broadsword.
A sleek top that is light and form fitting, with Aegisalt woven into the fabric for protection.
Toothpick. For picking teeth, or stabbing people.
Orangubang. A lethal warhammer.
A hood that hides the wearer - Perfect for covert operations.
Pants and boots that are far lighter than they appear - Ideal equipment for sneaking about.
Baby Barbaryan. A sturdy shortsword.
The Tickler. An unpleasant, ridged spear.
Crescendo. An axe shaped like a crescent moon.
Twintails. A dual-bladed sword.
The multiple layers of this upper body armour are seperate only with compact layers of Ferozium.
Fruitslicer. An ominous dagger.
Toecrusher. A hammer with a huge surface.
Headgear that completely covers the wearer's face, but has some classy goggles to see with.
This leg armour is reinforced with Ferozium, making it tough despite being fairly flexible.
Tiny Twintails. A dual-bladed sword.
See No Evil. A trident-like spear.
The Grinder. A lethal curved blade.
Ape Antics. A curvy, disconcerting blade.
Armored regal garmets which suit any would-be Assassin.
The Comb. A dagger that doubles as a hairdressing tool.
Big Ape's Lament. A hammer buzzing with energy.
This headgear is designed to disguise the wearer completely inconspicuously.
A classy set of pants and boots that are light enough for the wearer to make a quick getaway.
Monkey Business. A curvy, disconcerting blade.
Hear No Evil. A trident-like curved spear.
Orangufang. A two-pronged axe.
Howler. A lethal, barbed blade.
The giant pauldrons on this Violium armour show that the wearer means business.
Miniknog's Claw. A small, curved dagger.
King of the Dingers. A bell-shaped hammer.
A Violium-plated helmet which is downright terrifying to all that dare oppose you.
These Violium boots are made for walking - all over the wearer's enemies, that is.
Shrieker. A lethal, barbed blade.
Speak No Evil. A malevolent, spiked spear.
Miniknog Berserker. A hugely strong axe.
Gorilldrill. A grooved, curved sword.
This inpenetrable armour is mostly solid, flexible only at the neck, arm joints and midriff.
Liberation. A small, easily concealed dagger.
Lamb Shank. A gilded lamb shank turned into a hammer.
Few things are as intimidating as the expressionless stare from this Rubium plated helmet.
A set of leg armour with sturdy greaves that few things can pierce.
Mandrill. A grooved, curved sword.
Lethal Injection. A spear that also function as a syringe.
Apple pie! It's as American as itself!
An enhanced brain, perfect for transplanting.
Ash packed tight into a solid block.
Automatos! Be sure to spit out the screws.
An automato milkshake! Mmm.
A surprisingly tasty stew, if you watch out for the bits of metal.
Avesmingo, the plant of a 100 different flavours.
Avesmingos can taste like anything! For better or worse, so can this ice cream.
A juice that can taste like anything!
Typical Avian adventurer pants.
A typical Avian adventurer shirt.
Typical Avian commoner skirt.
A typical Avian commoner shirt.
A typical Avian fancy shirt.
Typical Avian fancy skirt.
A broken sword. Looks like it fell from a great height.
Sunborn Fury. An axe decorated with an Avian skull.
Wing of Kluex. A lethal, powerful broadsword.
A coat of Avian armour manufactured from impervium. Impossibly strong but impossibly light.
Lil Daedalus. A sizeable wing-like dagger.
The Drumstick. A hammer styled after a chicken's leg. With spikes.
Forged from pure impervium, this beautiful work of wearable art also protects against nearly anything thrown at it.
The processes used to construct these impervium leg coverings are lost in a piece of long forgotten lore, nevermore...
Crest of Kluex. A lethal, powerful shortsword.
Will of Kluex. A spear designed by Kluex himself.
Tiny Tomahawk. A small, versatile axe.
The Carver XL. A sword perfect for carving meat.
These iron shoulderplates represent the weight of your sins.
The Pecker. A tiny dagger that feels like a peck.
Brick-on-a-Stick. A chunk of iron on a stick.
A light iron circlet worn by Avian priesthood initiates.
And Kluex said, "Let there be iron-girded loincloths."
The Carver. A sword perfect for carving meat.
The Hatchling. A regular, basic spear.
Tomahawk. A larger, versatile axe.
The Skewer XL. A sword that doubles as a spit.
This ceremonial steel cape/plate combo is both comfortable and fashionable!
The Nibbler. A tiny dagger that feels like a nibble.
Brick-on-a-Stick Prime. A brick on a fancier stick.
A steel visor fashioned to block the wearer's view of the stars.
Steel-reinforced underpants, surprisingly comfortable.
The Skewer. A sword that doubles as a spit.
The Early Bird. A decorated, basic spear.
Hawkwing. A tomahawk with some feathers attached.
Wingdinger XL. A sword shaped like an Avian wing bone.
Slightly-itchy titanium plate, worn by Avian commoners around the galaxy.
Hookbeak. A little hooked dagger.
Stone-on-a-Stick. A hammer shaped like a stone.
Common Avian headwear, adorned with a fancy titanium plume.
Generic titanium pants, used for general pant-related duties.
Wingdinger. A sword shaped like an Avian wing bone.
Migrator. A decorated, sturdy spear.
Dove of War. A dove-shaped war axe.
Eye of the Storm. A sword with a gem encased in it.
A comfortable tunic, bound in durasteel for added durability.
Talon. A small dagger shaped like a talon.
Candy Crusher. A hammer that looks like a piece of candy.
Durasteel-based helmet worn by Avian spacefarers. Doesn't protect you from the vacuum of space, though...
This durasteel-lined skirt is snug in all the right places.
Eye of the Needle. A sword with a gem encased in it.
Swallowtail. A sleek, stylised spear.
Hawkbill. A hooked axe.
Wingwhacker Extreme. A sword that looks like a hefty wing.
This aegisalt chestplate's shoulders are at the perfect height for whacking Avians in the face as you walk by.
Wingtip. A deceptively sharp dagger shaped like the tip of a wing.
Divebomb. An exceptionally heavy, spiky hammer.
A comfortable (yet protective) aegisalt helm.
An aegisalt loincloth designed to allow movement while still protecting the legs.
Wingwhacker. A sword that looks like a hefty wing.
Bird in the Hand. A spear perfect for martial arts.
The Poliwanta Cracker. An axe with vibrant plumage.
Birdseye Two. A sword that cuts through fur and feathers.
A no-frills Ferozium shirt which emphasizes toughness over flair.
The Plucker. An easy to conceal dagger.
The Creamer. A spiky hammer that looks like a corn cob.
Gaudy yet hard as nails, this Ferozium headwear defends against all manner of dangers.
These slim-cut pants are woven from pure Ferozium thread for added durability.
Birdseye. A sword that cuts through fur and feathers.
Last Action Heron. A spear perfect for quick, rapid stabs.
Birdbrainer. An axe shaped like the head of an unknown bird.
Wingclipper XL. A hefty sword with a lot of weight behind it.
This skilfully designed chestplate will deflect the spears of the unbelievers. Praise Kluex!
Fly By Knife. A small knife with good air resistance.
The Scrambler. A hammer shaped like a large egg.
An ostentatious Cerulium-plated headdress for high-ranking Avian warriors.
Boots made from Cerulium are said to never take a wrong step. This has not been confirmed.
Wingclipper. A hefty sword with a lot of weight behind it.
The Roaster. A spear shaped like a Christmas turkey.
The Poliwanta Cleankill. A lethal, sharp axe with beautiful plumage.
Pelican Opener. A sword especially designed for taking down Glitch.
The heavy weight of each link in this Violium-mail suit strengthens the wearer's devotion to Kluex.
Thornbill. A little hooked dagger.
Master Hatcher. A hammer shaped like an egg. A chick is emerging.
Each feather in this ceremonial headdress is carved from pure Violium.
A lightweight pair of Violium-laced hotpants - not too tight, not too loose. Juuust right.
Toucan Opener. A sword especially designed for taking down Glitch.
Duckbilled Splatypus. A bill-shaped spear that also serves as a blunt instrument.
Wingbone. A decorated axe with a smooth bone handle.
Stargazer's Might. A hefty broadsword as carried by the first Stargazer.
The Rubium plating on this chestpiece makes it near-impenetrable by conventional weapons.
Lil Icarus. A flamboyant, wing-like dagger.
Skullgrazer. A hammer made from a decorative skull.
A shining battle helm made from bright, pure Rubium.
Some say that these Rubium leg-coverings grant their wearer mythical swiftness. Others say that it's all made up.
Stargazer's Light. A deft shortsword as carried by the first Stargazer.
Sunguard. A spear reportedly carried by the guardians of the Sunborn.
Typical Avian worker pants.
A typical Avian worker shirt.
Small glyphs cover the stone.
An advanced synthetic Avian material. Its markings are printed on.
Bamboo
What charmingly constructed bamboo platforms.
A genetically enhanced banana, could make anyone but an Apex sick.
Moist, delicious banana bread.
With bacon, a banana and some wizardry, you get...bananacon.
Better for eating, or for throwing in people's faces?
A giant banana mask. Banananananaaa!!!
The secret ingredient in this Apex favorite is pineapple!
No staring.
A bandage for healing minor wounds.
A bandit's hat.
A hood that hides the wearer - Perfect for covert operations.
300% Hair.
A banjo. Get ready to duel!
Kinky boots.
Thick metal bars. Still strong, though decaying with rust.
May or may not grant Code-Vision(tm)
A classy baseboard for the bottom of all your walls!
It's the pelt of an animal.
A bass guitar. Lay down some rhythm.
Your standard banana, battered and fried in a rich dough.
Luckily, not actual battery acid!
An extra large AA battery pack. Juice up!
Become the scourge of the galaxy with these terrifying wings.
Beakseed. Mmm crunchy.
A bear hat. For when you're feeling grizzly.
I think I found some honey in here. Nope, just more bees.
Convenient AND fattening!
A sassy felt hat. Wine and baguette sold separately.
A giant berry you can wear. Not to be confused with a beret.
Armour equipped with a snazzy scarf.
A mask, to keep the wearer's identity hidden.
Stay protected with these fashionable armoured trousers.
A crumble that holds a charge.
A dark-tinted glass material.
Sharp rocks produced by blasts of enormous heat.
A thick, shake-like drink of meat and pussplum.
A blue dye. Can be used to dye armour.
A tile with a strange blue glyph engraved in the centre.
Used for crafting
A stimpack full of blue liquid
A bowl of rather bland boiled pearlpeas.
A small metal bolt.
Boltbulb! Surprisingly soft.
It's milk with a twist!
Bolt O's, for when you wake up so hungry you don't care what you're putting in your mouth!
A great way to blow up blocks. Be careful where you throw them!
It's a bone.
Mmm crumbly.
The creamy, spongey innards of the boneboo fruit.
Polished bone made into a building material.
A bone xylophone. Produces a killer sound.
Makeshift armour chestpiece. For the resourceful.
Makeshift armour helmet. For the resourceful.
Makeshift armour greaves. For the resourceful.
A pile of dusty old books, they're full of tales of dragons and knights.
Fresh, clean water.
A hunting bow, monsters killed with a bow drop tasty meat.
The bodacity of that boxman...it was bodacious!
This brain looks to be perfect for experimentation.
Terminating a common monster with this gun will extract its brain.
Pulsating brain matter.. I wonder what it's thinking.
Mmm, fresh out of the oven.
Small but perfectly formed bricks. Quaint.
Jellied coralcreep inside of a glazed pineapple, served warm. A fancy Hylotl treat!
Press and hold Jump in the air to float around with this Bubble Boost tech.
A bubble gun! It shoots bubbles! Weeeee!
Whaleskin Pirate coat. Well it smells like whale anyway.
My hat, it has three corners, three corners has my hat!
Pirate pants, with holes for legs (peg or otherwise).
A living bunny wants to rest on your head!
A juicy hamburger.
Watch out, they're super spicy!
A bean and cheese burrito. Deliciously unhealthy!
A Buster gun.
For making everything less healthy and more awesome.
Press and hold Jump in the air to float around with this Butterfly Boost tech.
cacti.
It's a delicious cake!
Press and hold Jump in the air to float around with this Cameraman Boost tech.
Handy for when you want to record without being seen!
It looks like the old Earthling Halloween treat, but...there's actual corn in the center of each morsel.
Pearlpeas are roasted in sugar and shoved on a stick.
Hard candy. It probably won't do much for me if I'm starving, but it sure is tasty.
All the nutritious value of an apple masked by globs of sweet, sweet sugar.
It's like an automato-flavored lollipop! Which is kind of weird.
Sweet-smelling rock candy!
Canned food. Not the best, but it'll do in a pinch.
-50 intelligence when worn sideways.
Who is the captain?  The person who wears this!
Throw it at a small grounded monster below 50% health. Maybe you'll get lucky.
Imagination is the key to true power!
Because who wants to spend money on a fancy hat?
Mmm crunchy.
A loaf of carrot bread. Let's be honest, it's just bread-shaped cake.
It's a delicious carrot cake! Tastes better than it sounds.
I'm huntin' wabbits.
Mild and sweet carrot juice!
Strong stone slabs, perfect for building a castle.
Small stone slabs, perfect for the finer details.
A helmet donned by a once-feared warrior.
cellmateria
Cell Matter
Steel chains, and not the fun kind.
Cheap, tacky wallpaper.
A wedge of cheese.
Given to every chef when they pass their chef exams.
To make the wearer look like a professional chef.
An apron to protect the important areas from oil spillages.
Super hot, only suitable for humans.
A delicious beefy chili. Spicy!
Just objectively the best thing ever.
It's a typical circuit board.
A clarinet. Try not to squeak.
Dry and dusty clay.
One use, but what a useful use it is. Use it.
A punkish top hat with a clock in it.
It's coal. A decent source of fuel.
Small bricks made of cobblestone.
Hard stones, smooth to the touch.

State of the badass art.
A smooth panel made of titanium.
A casual shirt.
Some casual pants
Cold, hard, concrete.
A slab of delicious cooked alien meat.
Bacon strips & bacon strips & bacon strips & bacon strips!
It's a cooked hunk of flesh of questionable origin.
A haunch of roasted ham.
A nice, roasted bird.
Pass the barbecue sauce!
It's a roasted tentacle. Chewy...but still pretty good?
A cool jacket, too cool for drycleaning.
Fezzes are...  neat!
Made of real faux-leather. Too cool.
Copper chestpiece. For the practical.
Copper helmet. For the practical.
Copper greaves. For the practical.
It's a copper bar.
A copper drill! This is more like it.
A kiwi pie with a bit of a coppery kick.
A copper ladder
Copper ore. Can be used for smelting or repairs. Select ore and right click pickaxe.
Pickaxes are so last millennium! This one is made of copper.
A copper platform
The berries are poisonous to anyone but those of aquatic disposition.
A mildly spicy curry made with the coralcreep plant.
Good for digestion!
A buttery ear of corn on the cob.
Your standard ear of sweetcorn, but with dirturchin spread on top. Mmm!
Beakseed and dried corn makes for a common Avian trail mix.
The famous Glitch chef responsible for Smash and Bolt-O's also invented Corntent, and nobody is quite sure why.
A person can be a hat too, right?
Ick. Corrupted dirt.
A bit dirtswept.
Ye-Haw!! Ride a bull with this hat on.
Made with real buffalo leather.
Craftsmen clothing, high fashion.
Craftsmen pants, high fashion.
A crayon. Bring some colour to your outfit.
A mouldy lattice made of wood.
Upside CROWN cake! Haha! Get it? Sigh...
Shiny crystal.
A shiny backpack made of crystal. Stylish.
A shining blue block of made of crystals.
A crystal plant
A cultist's chestpiece.
A Cultist's head armour
A cultist's leg armour
Grows currentcorn, full of acid. Not good for fleshy creatures.
Curried, crunchy beakseeds with hot chili peppers. Mmm.
A strong cider made of oculemon and pussplum.
A dangerous barrel. Try not to have a wardrobe malfunction.
A dark, smooth stone block. Mysterious.
I think I see alien woodworm.
Double tap Left or Right to use this Energy Dash tech.
OH NO NOT THE BEES NO NO ARGH MY EYES
Hard Hat. It's Hard. And a hat.
It's a beautifully cut diamond.
Diamond chestpiece. Sparkles!
Diamond helmet. Sparkles!
Diamond greaves. Sparkles!
A diamond drill! This is more like it.
Diamond ore. Can be used for smelting or repairs. Select ore and right click pickaxe.
Pickaxes are so last millennium! This one is made of diamond.
So retro, it's Prehistoric.
Diodia, tastes like copper.
Little wormlike forms wriggle beneath the surface of this glassy stone.
Tea made by steeping dried dirturchin leaves in boiling water. A traditional drink.
Dirty looking dirt.
Kind of squidy and a bit tasteless.
Get one up on your peers.
Not really a med kit. For when you absolutely, positively have to be 100% cheaty.
Press Jump in the air to use this Pulse Jump tech.
A dragon bone, it's hot to the touch. The heat never dies.
Every girl needs to accessorise with a belt.
Fashionable and airy!
A drum kit. Better warn the neighbours.
Dirt, dried solid in the sun.
Hard, cracked sand that shatters underfoot.
A hammered dulcimer. Bash out a tune.
It's a durasteel bar.
It's an egg!
Fried rice, a Hylotl staple.
Eggshoot, I like the yoke.
A simple side salad of eggshoot and feathercrown.
An electric bass guitar. Lay down some rhythm.
An electro grenade. Shocking!
A strange jelly that seems to react to touch.
A powerful javelin full of kinetic energy.
Explorer's Chestpiece. This armour is perfect for exploring in.
Explorer's Leg Armour. This armour is perfect for exploring in.
A cape that sees all. Hold the ctrl key to see further than ever!
A giant eyeball mask. It lacks depth perception...
Oculemon stuffed inside half an eggshoot-- a popular hors d'oeuvres at Floran gatherings.
A helmet with a big eyeball in the centre. Practical!
Your piercing gaze should instil fear into even the bravest heart.
A small square of fabric.
Oh no, a face leech! Oh, but wait, it's friendly. Alright, little guy, you can stay.
Soft faded brick.
Back Flaps. Not sure what they are for, but it feels pretty.
Dance top, provides 300% less jiggle.
Jewel encrusted metal party hat, it came from a pretty big christmas cracker.
Its frilly but it wont keep your sugar plums warm.
A fancy bowler hat. Distinguished.
Feathercrown, you have to pluck it before consuming.
Sing it with me: Fedoras are awesome!!!
A microphone. For all the soulful divas out there.
A sturdy wooden fence.
Throw it... Who knows what'll happen?
Fills up your ship's fuel
NOW you mine fish.
Tasty fried fish in stick form. Where's the custard?
A whole fish shoved haphazardly inside a boneboo.
Fry all the things! This is an old Earthling favorite.
Good for lighting up a dark cave before you dive into it.
A handy flashlight! Seems to be powered by my energy pool.
A hideous, foul-smelling block made of some kind of flesh.
A long, sinewy strand of flesh.
Perfect for taking tea on the lawn.
The fur left over from a recent meaty corpse!
The fur left over from a recent meaty corpse!
The fur left over from a recent meaty corpse!
The fur left over from a recent meaty corpse!
The leaf censors stuff children shouldn't see!
The leaf censors stuff children shouldn't see!
Dead animal skin and fur makes me warm.
Dead animal skin and fur makes me warm.
A broken sword. Looks like a Floran's chewed on it.
Clean leather from dead stuff.
Clean leather from dead stuff.
Choppatron 3000. A Floran's favourite axe.
The Slashening. A sword made of thorny vines.
The synthesizers chestguard channels so much power from the sun it can get hot to the touch.
Slashmaster. A tiny, lethal dagger.
Smash Everything. The best of all hammers.
The armour of the synthesizer is coated with pure impervium.
A kick from an armored synthesizer can shatter bone.
The Cuttening. A sword made of thorny vines.
Huntmaster. A spear fashioned out of the bones of a great hunt.
Choppy Thing. A basic Floran axe.
Big Slicer. A basic broadsword.
It's rare to see a sprout chestguard not covered in dents, blood and sometimes vital organs.
Curvy Slice. A curved dagger.
Smacker. A basic hammer.
Iron armour usually lifted from the (often severed) head of fallen floran that failed to reach adulthood.
These anklets are built scant to remind young floran to draw power from the sun.
Slicer. A basic shortsword.
Poker. A basic spear.
Better Choppy Thing. A decent Floran axe.
Big Slicestabber. For slicing and stabbing.
Steel, reinforced with bone and padded with leather made from the skin of hunted prey.
Hookslicer. A small, stabby dagger with a hook.
Thwacker. A decent hammer.
The bonesmith's helm is usually decorated with the steel covered skull of the wearers first victim.
Ground stomach contents was used to dye this loincloth and boots.
Slicestabber. For slicing and stabbing.
Pokerface. A spear on a stick.
Choppy Leaves. An axe decorated with leaves.
Big Slicestabcut. For slicing, stabbing and cutting.
A nomads armour is built to turn the elements as well as a blade.
Sharpstick. A dagger on a stick.
Cracker. A good hammer.
Built from rugged titanium and wrapped in leaves for warmth, this is the armour of choice for the floran nomad.
Nomad armour is said to smell of dying flowers and rotting leaves.
Slicestabcut. For slicing, stabbing and cutting.
Strippoker. A spear on a fancy stick.
Chop Stick. An axe attached to a strong stick.
Big Nastyslice. A sword that really hurts.
The hunter's chestguard protect's the hunter's vitals with solid durasteel.
Fingercutter. A little, finger-sized dagger.
Trunkthunk. A hammer made from a tree trunk.
The hunter's hood is built to be light, allowing a floran to track it's prey many miles.
The hunter's skirt is built from leather with a thread of durasteel holding it together.
Nastyslice. A sword that really hurts.
Stabber. A strong spear.
Treechopper. An axe made from a small tree.
Big Bindslicer. A sword bound in vines.
Disgraced floran are thrown unarmored into an arena with a hungry floran cannibal.
Planttrimmer. A dagger decorated with leaves.
Rootripper. A hammer made of tree roots.
The cannibal's mask contains razor sharp aegisalt teeth built to tear through floran flesh.
It's said the sun itself could not stand between a cannibal and his meal.
Bindslicer. A sword bound in vines.
Backstabber. An excellent spear.
Chopberry. An axe with a berry on it.
Big Gougeslicer. A sword with all manner of nasty hooked bits.
Florans believe to devourer a fallen wiseman's brain is to gain their wisdom.
Planttrimmer Prime. A dangerous dagger decorated with leaves.
Smashy Tree. A tree which can be used a hammer.
This Ferozium headpiece is built to protect a floran wiseman's brain at all costs.
Upstairs for thinking, downstairs for dancing.
Gougeslicer. A sword with all manner of nasty hooked bits.
Facestabber. A spear with a menacing appearance.
Chopflower. An axe with a flower on it.
Rosebud Prime. A treasured Floran sword.
The floran gatherer's Cerulium chestpiece is the last thing many a scientist sees.
Little Thorn. A rose by any other name.
Curlycrush. A curly, spiky hammer.
As with much of Floran technology, the gatherer's helm is built from the tech of fallen foes.
The gatherers skirt makes the sound of rustling leaves as they creep towards their prey.
Rosebud. A treasured Floran sword.
StabStabStab. A spear with two smaller prongs on it.
Vine. An axe that cuts through anything in six seconds.
Big Berryskewer. A sword decorated with berries.
As part of the florans organised offensive force, no expense is spared infusing a sentinel's armour with Violium.
Berrypicker. A sharp dagger covered in berries.
Rootrocker. Roots holding a rock.
The floran sentinel's helm is made from foes with particularly hard skin.
When the floran sentinel's march it sounds like a thunderstorm.
Berryskewer. A sword decorated with berries.
Stabberry. A lethal spear with berries on it.
Bonechopper. An axe decorated with a skull. Chilling.
Big Leafslasher. A dangerous, serrated sword.
The shamans chestguard is built from a net of Rubium, as strong as any breastplate.
Razorleaf. A dagger hidden behind a leaf.
Riftwood. A hefty slab of wood made into a hammer.
The floran shaman is said to channel the words of the sun.
The shaman's skirt is deceptively strong and wonderfully flexible.
Leafslasher. A dangerous, serrated sword.
Treeshredder. A serrated spear with a leaf on it.
A flute. But is it magic?
Various fruits all conveniently mixed together.
A fullmetal battery. It's huge!
An fullmetal chest piece!  Looks bulky.
A fullmetal helmet!  Wow!
Some fullmetal pants!
Rough and unrefined, this wood looks freshly chopped.
Rough and unrefined, this wood looks freshly chopped.
A big bowl of leafy greens and veggies. Nutritious!
A gas grenade. It doesn't smell nice!
Are you my mummy?
A sexy combination of an awesome jacket and a stylish green shirt made specifically for George. Be in awe!
Some sexy glasses that belong to George. Can you handle them!?
Some form fitting and sexy pants made specifically for George's bodacious curves! Bask in the glory!
A giant flower petal. Soft!
A strong looking metal girder.
These used to belong to a very fine lady.
Look like a real english gentleman.
I can see my reflection... it's hideous!
Use this tech, spawn a mech. Then destroy things.
A crown for the Glitch in power.
A broken sword. Looks like it needs maintenance.
Sentinel. An axe that might just be sentient.
Rootkit. A sword that'll cut through anything.
The doom lord's breastplate is forged of heavy impervium lined with gold. They're said to contain the brains of the first glitch.
Windowcutter. A dagger so sharp it cuts glass.
iDoom. A hammer that spells doom for all who encounter it.
The doom lords are known to most glitch as a fairytale, but this helm is very real.
The doom lord's boots rattle a planet with each step.
Rootkit Lite. A sword that'll cut through almost anything.
Social Wetwork. A spear perfect for assassinating in a crowd.
Ratchet. A robot's basic hatchet.
Default 2.0. A basic Glitch broadsword.
A knave's breastplate is plain and unadorned, reflecting their position in society.
Dagger Home. A small, basic dagger.
Crunch. A basic hammer.
The iron helm of the knave, it only protects the top of the head.
Most of the iron in a knave's pants is in the belt buckle.
Default 1.0. A basic Glitch shortsword.
Ping. A basic spear.
Steelsplitter. A steel axe.
Upgrade 2.0. A solid Glitch broadsword.
The soldier is the most expendable position in a Glitch army.
Dagger Pro. A decent dagger.
Steelforger. Forged of steel, forges steel. Steel.
The soldier's steel helm accents many thousands of faces on the glitch battlefield.
The lifespan of a glitch soldier is as short as these pants.
Upgrade 1.0. A solid Glitch shortsword.
Nudge. A decent spear.
Smitanium. A titanium axe.
Premium 2.0. A nice Glitch broadsword.
The strength of a knight's breastplate allows a single knight to slay many a soldier on the battlefield.
Dagger Premium. A good dagger.
Safareach. A hammer with a decent reach.
The titanium clad glitch knight fights with honor (and a sharp sword).
The knight's greaves sit heavy at it's sides. Only a strong mechanical horse will carry the wearer of these.
Premium 1.0. A nice Glitch shortsword.
Poke. A good spear.
Screwslicer. An axe perfect for cutting down screws.
Antivirus. A sword useful for taking out pests.
Dark knights improve their breastplates with durasteel, believing strong armour triumphs over honour.
dieOS. A small, manoeuvrable dagger.
Flash Upswing. A hammer good for uppercutting.
The dark knight's durasteel helm clouds the face in mystery.
The dark knights greaves provide some of the most adequate crotch protection in the entire universe.
Antispyware. A sword useful for taking out pests.
Friend Request. A spear that can hook things towards you.
Cogsmasher. Suitable for heavy machine-work.
Defender. A great defensive broadsword.
The lancer's breastplate is capable of absorbing shock enough to keep a rider on his mount whilst shattering a lance.
Prunix. A dagger that'll shave the top off anything.
Microchip. A hammer with a chisel-like edge.
A lancers helm is aerodynamic, built from aegisalt it's light and sturdy.
The lancers greaves are built for riding.
Protector. A great defensive shortsword.
Privacy Settings. A perfect spear for defence.
Battle Axe. An axe of battle.
Trojan. A sword great for offence.
The crusader's breastplate is forged of pure Ferozium. It contains a third brain for extra long crusades.
Force Restart. A chunky, strong dagger.
Internal Explorer. A hammer that'll shatter any Glitch outer shells.
The crusader's helm contains an extra brain for paritcularly long crusades.
The crusaders greaves do not contain an extra brain, that would be ridiculous.
Malware. A sword great for offence.
Followback. A spear perfect for countering with.
War Axe. An axe of war.
Dataspike. A spiked blade.
The paladin's breastplate is forged of Cerulium, a metal believed to be holy.
Spinux. A spiny dagger.
Bruteforce Lite. A solid mallet.
The paladin is believed to be the holiest of warriors, striking where god demands.
The paladin's greaves protect both their legs and their chastity.
Datablip. A spiked blade.
Spike This. A spiky spear.
Perpetuum. An axe you can swing forever.
Hacker. A hefty broadsword.
the templar's breastplate is forged of Violium, an additional templar brain warns of incoming blows.
KitKut. A strong, durable dagger.
Bruteforce Prime. A very solid mallet.
The templar's helm is capable of housing the brains of fallen templars so they may live on.
The templars are a mysterious order some say secretly run glitch society.
Scriptkiddie. A hefty shortsword.
The Blocker. An exceptionally strong spear.
Domecutter. A lethal, terrifying axe.
Bios. A sword that'll split anyone in twain.
The legionnarie's breastplate is forged of Rubium, it's said to hold not only glitch brains, but souls.
Operating System. A dagger that'll pierce any hide.
Chromedome. A smooth, lethal hammer.
The legionnaire's are the forward thinking elite knights of the empire. Their helms reflect the fashions of the future.
Legionnaire's insist people call their loincloth a toga.
Startup. A sword that'll split anyone in twain.
Splitter. A long, straight, lethal spear.
The Night Light. For when only another sentient being will do as a light source.
Gold chestpiece. For the decadent.
Gold helmet. For the decadent.
Gold greaves. For the decadent.
It's a gold bar that must be worth a lot!
A whole block of solid gold.
Pixels, used for 3D Printing; they have become a universal currency.
A gold drill! This is more like it.
It's some gold ore.
Pickaxes are so last millennium! This one is made of gold.
A plain, golden sword probably worth a lot of money.
A sweet juice made of grapes.
Grapes, nature's snackfood.
Oh my god, whee! This is so fun!
A thin gravel.
A tart green apple, ripe for baking or consuming with my face!
A green flashlight! A mighty glow.
A tile with a strange green glyph engraved in the centre.
A stimpack full of green liquid
Whoever thought to stick ham between two slices of bread was a genius.
USCM Standard Issue Hand Grenade. Has 3 second fuse.
A harmonica. Favourite instrument of grizzled space captains.
A harp. Plucky.
A hazmat airtank.
A hazmat shirt.
A hazmat mask.
Some hazmat pants.
Burst of Energy. A healing bomb.
Eww, a fleshy looking material!
It is said this cap once belonged to a hero of legend.
The perfect backpack to store all the essentials for exploring.
Makes the wearer feel like they could scale any mountain.
Sturdy Material make these perfect for finding mountain monsters.
A solid material made from the remains of fallen creatures... I think I see an eyeball.
Mind your aim! These creepy critters can eat through just about anything.
+1% rain resistance when dry.
A hoe. Time for some gardening.
The essence of the holiday season, in its purest form!
Nicely painted brickwork.
Headwear you just can't refuse.
Boneboo roasted with chilis makes for a crunchy, spicy Floran treat.
Mrs. Claus's holiday coat.
Mrs. Claus's holiday hat!
Mrs. Claus's traditional pants.

A broken sword. Looks like it's been wrenched from a stone.
iAxe. The most expensive axe money can buy.
Bane of the Gods. A serrated sword with a few hidden surprises.
This jacket is usually worn by those privy to some of the Universe's best kept secrets.
King's Ruin. A gilded dagger fit for a King (to be stabbed with).
Timmy. The lord of all mallets.
This impervium helm contains a voice box changer. Side effects may include picking up any heavy breathing.
Impervium pants will tread a thousand alien worlds in their lifetime.

Alienbane. A spear that could take down any alien.

Shanker. A basic, no-nonsense dagger.

This iron armour is favoured by lone humans scratching out an existance amongst the stars.
A scavenger cares little for fashion.
Regular Shortsword. A normal, unremarkable shortsword.
Basic Spear. A spear which is basic.
Ice Axe. A good axe for mountain climbing.
Cool Broadsword. A regular broadsword modified to look cooler.
A strong, light steel chestguard.
Fancy Shanker. A basic, decorated dagger.
Claw Hammer. A sledgehammer with a clawed end.

The scout's steel boots leave a distinct footprint.
Cool Shortsword. A regular shortsword modified to look cooler.
Spear Today. A popular spear.
Vibro-axe. An axe that vibrates softly when it hits stone.
Awesome Broadsword. A regular broadsword made to look awesome.
A chestguard protects the pioneer's first steps into a new world.
Swanky Shanker. A posh, jewel-encrusted basic dagger.
Strengthtester. A hammer for the strong.
The sleek titanium helm of the pioneer.
Titanium pants with a convenient flap for the release of bodily fluids.
Awesome Shortsword. A regular shortsword made to look awesome.
Prong Tomorrow. A futuristic-looking spear.
Class Axe. A stylish, practical axe.
The Overcompensator. The blacksmith is getting carried away now.

Switchblade. A switchblade with a ruby on it.
Hammertime. A pretty swish hammer.
The Durasteel helm of the outrider is built for communication. This one doesn't work.
These Durasteel pants are built for the rider of a hoverbike.
The Compensator. The blacksmith is getting carried away now.
The Rhino. A spear with a little horn on it.
Climbing Axe. A hooked axe, usefull for rock-climbing.
The Tuning Fork. A dual-bladed sword, also good for band practise.
Chosen for its strength on the battlefield. The vanguard flak jacket has saved many lives.
Greengrip. Named as such because the grip is green. Obviously.
Double Hammertime. Like Hammertime, but twice as strong.
This aegisalt helm is usually worn by the vanguard, the human armoured forces.
The vanguard fight with passion, honour and aegisalt pants.
The Pitch Fork. A dual-bladed sword, also good for band practise.
Cattleprodder. A spear shaped like a cattleprod.
Charitable Axe. An axe trimmed with gold
The Paddle. A hefty sword that packs a punch.
Circuitry runs throughout this entire unit, it regulates breath rate and aids in producing a meditative state.
Zweifinger. Like a Zweihander, but tiny.
Timesmasher. A hammer that can smash even grandfather clocks.
This tall helmet has brain-amplifying circuitry running throughout the inside.
These pants count the number of steps you take through sophisticated circuitry.
Mini-Paddle. A hefty shortsword that packs a punch.
Cattlekiller. A spear shaped like a cattle prod, but deadlier.
Opposing Force. A wrench which has been converted into an axe.
Paddlemaster 5000. A hefty sword that packs even more of a punch.
The wanderer's job is to meet and greet newly discovered races. Sometimes this goes wrong, hence the chestguard.
Small Fury. A little barbed dagger.
Hobbyhammer. A hammer that could also be a child's toy.
This Cerulium helm was built when humans made contact with a particularly odd looking race. The fashion stuck.
Built for diplomacy the wanderer's armour is designed to look non-threatening.
Paddlemaster 1000. A hefty shortsword that packs even more of a punch.
Backstabber. A large spear perfect for stabbing.
All-Purpose Axe. An axe which is good for everything.
Treesplitter. A sword so heavy it can split trees.
Violium makes this chestguard incredibly strong.
Kneesplitter. A chunky, strong dagger.
Pumphammer. A hammer with pump action - but for what?
After meeting the Glitch, human adventurers adopted a new style of helm.
These pants are a little stiff, but really finish off the robotic look.
Sapsplitter. A sword so heavy it can split... saplings? Great.
Headspiker. A swift, adaptable spear.
The Wiggler. An axe that looks like it's trying to wiggle away.
Moonkiller. A sword so strong it could cut the moon in half.

The Unsubtle Knife. A large, hard-to-conceal dagger.
Lifecrusher. A very lethal hammer.

Special Rubium kneeguards help with crawling through air ducts.
Moonchipper. A sword so heavy it could chip the moon.
The Menacer. An intimidating spear.
Warning: this item is a prop. Not to be used for direct combat.
Comes with Apex manifesto and spitting tobacco.

A sharp hunting knife, makes monsters drop meat.
A broken sword. Looks like it got eaten by a shark.

Plantpounder. A hammer that will crush any Floran.

The Pitchfork. Perfect for uprooting a certain plant-like species.
Scythe. A small scythe.

Seastaff. A basic spear.

Swishbuckler. A decent pirate sword.
Parts of this steel breastplate are dyed to match the wearers aquatic mount.
Fishfang. A basic hooked dagger.

Steel greaves built with a grip that keeps the wearer steady when riding a giant fish.

With their aegisalt helms, reef gatherers would spend hours amongst the coral searching for precious material.
